Quotes: There is no fate that cannot be surmounted by scorn.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: We always deceive ourselves twice about the people we love - first to their advantage, then to their disadvantage.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: I used to go away for weeks in a state of confusion.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: When you give yourself, you receive more than you give.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

Quotes: People that are conceited of their own merit take pride in being unfortunate, that themselves and others may think them considerable enough to be the envy and the mark of fortune.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Most of our faults are more pardonable than the means we use to conceal them.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Forgiveness is the fragrance that the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: My mother had a great deal of trouble with me, but I think she enjoyed it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: I can live for two months on a good compliment.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: One's past is what one is. It is the only way by which people should be judged.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Well, for us, in history where goodness is a rare pearl, he who was good almost takes precedence over he who was great.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: A man loves the meat in his youth that he cannot endure in his age.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: The golden age is before us, not behind us.
Author: William Shakespeare
